Items.Title:
Communication from the Office of the City Clerk – Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Elizabeth Crowley, as the new Council Member of the 30th Council District, Queens County.

THE ACTING CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER ELIZABETH CROWLEY TAKING HER OATH OF OFFICE

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Members Arroyo and Mark-Viverito:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 080533 PCY, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Site selection and acquisition of easements (Block 2543, p/o Lot 1 and Block 2583, p/o Lot 2) for use as a pedestrian and bicycle pathway (C080533 PCY)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Sanders:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20090087 PSQ shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Site selection of property generally bounded by Rockaway Boulevard and North Boundary Road (Block 14260, p/o Lot 1) for use as evidence vehicle storage, Queens (20090087PSQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Yassky:
pplication no. 20085477 TCK, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Enid’s Corporation, to continue to maintain and operate an enclosed sidewalk café located at560 Manhattan Avenue, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café located at 560 Manhattan Ave, Brooklyn (20085477TCK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law in relation to the grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, and the date of submission by the campaign finance board of estimates of the financial needs of the campaign finance board, relating to the fiscal year two thousand ten.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Change the date of submission by the Mayor of the preliminary budget from January 16, 2009 to not later than January 30, 2009, and would adjust other dates in the budget process accordingly.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Public Safety
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports concerning the discharge of firearms.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to submit reports concerning the discharge of firearms to the council.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, and the date of submission by the campaign finance board of estimates of the financial needs of the campaign finance board, relating to the fiscal year two thousand ten.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to reintroduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, S. 7587 and A. 10615 of 2008, which would create 39 additional Family Court judgeships throughout New York State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Create 39 additional Family Court judgeships throughout NYS (S.7587/ A.10615)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a grace period for certain parking violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establishing a grace period for certain parking violations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Congressional delegation to urge the President of the United States to issue an Executive Order that would ensure humane prisoner treatment and ban torture and cruel or degrading treatment of prisoners while in custody.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Ensure humane prisoner treatment and ban torture and cruel or degrading treatment of prisoners while in custody.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to street cleaning and the collection and removal of solid waste and recyclable materials at street events.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Street cleaning and the collection and removal of recyclable materials and refuse at street events.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A. 6807 and S. 3185 of 2009, which authorize political subdivisions to award public procurement contracts to participants of a minority and women owned business enterprise program at a cost premium not to exceed ten percent of the lowest bid.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Authorize political subdivisions to award public procurement contracts to participants of a minority and women owned business enterprise program at a cost premium not to exceed 10% of the lowest bid.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, and the date of submission by the campaign finance board of estimates of the financial needs of the campaign finance board, relating to the fiscal year two thousand ten.

Items.Title: Application no. C 070443 MMX submitted by the New York City Economic Development Corporation and the Department of Small Business Services, pursuant to Section  197-c and 199 of the New York City Charter and Section 5-430 et seq. of the New York Administrative Code for the amendment to the City Map, Community District 2, Borough of the Bronx.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20 b of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.MatterName: New York City Economic Development Corporation and the Department of Small Business Services (070443 MMX)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the First Deputy City Clerk and the Acting Clerk of the Council performed the formal swearing-in ceremony of newly elected Council Member Elizabeth Crowley.  Council Member Crowley took the oath of office as Council Member of the 30th Council District, Queens County.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
